data.text: “Vaccine policy is the most urgent and important economic policy – a top priority for macroeconomic stability.” Read more in Deputy Managing Director Antoinette M. Sayeh’s remarks at @HarvardGrwthLab: https://t.co/5CNMcwBKKv https://t.co/RjqXGdg5DG

Countries need to transition to clean energy sources now, but that won’t happen overnight. Carbon pricing is just one way we can work to bring carbon emissions down to net zero & fight #climatechange. So what exactly is it? Watch this video to learn more.
https://t.co/sGkXdrOVAt https://t.co/WyLlOfxNns

As green energy costs drop, we should shift the emphasis from economy-wide carbon pricing to sector-specific policies, writes James H. Stock for #FandD’s climate issue, produced in partnership with @COP26. https://t.co/hOiz66PhLG https://t.co/RWd4DKdrFy
What is carbon pricing? In short, it would make clean energy sources like solar and wind cheaper than dirty ones polluting the #environment. https://t.co/sGkXds6ws1 https://t.co/sC9aD7ri5c

Policy priorities for #Georgia from the IMF: reduce the deficit as the economy recovers, reform state-owned enterprises, ensure inflation expectations remain anchored, preserve the strength of the financial sector, and undertake structural reforms to tackle employment bottlenecks https://t.co/XaWh55OemA

🇬🇪 #Georgia’s recovery is underway, with growth of around 7.5% projected for 2021–exceeding its pre-pandemic pace. But Georgia still needs to contain the pandemic to secure this recovery. Read the IMF press release to learn more: https://t.co/JgPywHoHbR https://t.co/xoOIXWMXmg

Finland was the first country to introduce a carbon tax in 1990. Now the country aims to be the first advanced carbon-neutral country by 2035. A look at how wood is helping to achieve this goal. https://t.co/EZpEDtkLKe #FandD https://t.co/CZggc3PqCX

#Morocco 🇲🇦 already publishes an annual report & has increased its transparency of the sector in its annual budget. And #Georgia 🇬🇪 frequently identifies sources of risk and looks for ways to manage and mitigate them. Read our latest report to learn more: https://t.co/1fOXM1PEGr https://t.co/FBUUUCEz5f

Many governments in the region understand the need to prioritize reforms and are already working to strengthen them and manage risks. But more could be done to improve governance and transparency. Here are the IMF’s top 5 recommendations: https://t.co/QQYTJythbn

The businesses often perform poorly because of weak oversight, limited competition, political interference, and few budget constraints. Read our latest report on state-owned enterprises in the #MiddleEast, #NorthAfrica, and #CentralAsia to learn more: https://t.co/1fOXM1PEGr https://t.co/SGmY4DnvHl

IMF research shows that these firms are often less profitable than similar companies in the private sector. In #Afghanistan 🇦🇫 and #Pakistan 🇵🇰, for example, most operate at a loss. https://t.co/opSwCDrjKN

Governments have different reasons to own these firms, but many exist in areas that would ideally be run by the private sector—like 🇩🇿 #Algeria’s leather industry, 🇮🇶 #Iraq’s furniture & dairy production, 🇱🇧 #Lebanon’s communication sector, and 🇹🇯 #Tajikistan’s cement production. https://t.co/SgsJl86y8D

🧵on state-owned enterprises in the Middle East, North Africa, and Central Asia:

This type of business is plentiful in the region—especially in #Azerbaijan 🇦🇿 and #Uzbekistan 🇺🇿, which had 4,496 and 1,735 SOEs, respectively, in 2019. https://t.co/NW3KtVq2h2
